content: I do not have access to up-to-date information on specific cases where discogs has evaluated a record's value significantly higher or lower than the seller initially expected. however, the valuation of a record can be influenced by various factors such as its rarity, condition, pressing, demand, and historical significance, among others. additionally, discogs uses a marketplace algorithm to determine the value of a record based on recent sales history, supply and demand, and sale conditions. this may sometimes result in discrepancies between the seller's expected value and the actual value derived from the marketplace algorithm.
